alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:59PM EDT until July 03 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHERN PERRY...NORTHWESTERN MEADE...NORTHERN HANCOCK AND NORTHWESTERN BRECKINRIDGE COUNTIES... At 458 PM EDT/358 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles southwest of Carefree Town, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Tell City, Hawesville, Lewisport, Cannelton, Troy, Raymond, Frymire, Gerald, Dodd and Andyville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
